column2: A confederacy is based upon feudal government, featuring a loose association of autonomous rulers under the banner of a single individual. Unlike feudal government, a confederacy is never intended to be centralized, and only Elective Succession is allowed. A confederate ruler does not control their vassal levies, and must instead call them to war to fight on their behalf.

The Imperial Commune form of government is an oligarchial form of feudal elective government established by some of the Imperial City's most powerful families in the wake of the Potentate's collapse and the chaos the ensued. It's primary purpose is to protect the Imperial Isle and the interests of it's rulers. It claims to derive power from the vestiges of the defunct Elder Council, an institution of the former Empire.

The Imperial Republic form of government is a more centralized and stable form of the Imperial Commune, having been brought back from the brink of death and nursed back to become stronger than ever. While still privy to the machinations of the various noble houses of the Imperial Province, the ruler is a far more respected figure with much more sway and power than in the erstwhile Commune. The seat of Emperors is within your grasp!

The Mane's system of government follows most of the fundamentals of feudalism, but contains several caveats due to the Mane's unique status as a secular and religious ruler. The Mane may hold temples at no penalty, and is permitted to have concubines. Whenever the Mane dies, a new Mane - always a male Khajiit, newly born under a unique alignment of the Moons - is selected.

Tsaesci matriarchy closely resembles feudal government and depends upon a contract between liege and vassal, but as its name indicates, it is dominated by females. Only females are allowed to inherit matriarchies, and while it is not unheard of for a male to control a matriarchy, they will draw the ire of vassal matriarchs for violating the conventions of this system.

Orcish government is fundamentally similar to feudal government, with chieftains who rule from strongholds and maintain vassals. However, there are many influences from the Code of Malacath that set this system apart. Only males may inherit titles, and may keep multiple wives. They also rule for life, with the eldest or most powerful son inheriting, but can be (and frequently are) challenged by offspring, relatives or vassals who may slay them in personal combat for their titles. The laws of the land are determined solely by the ruler, not by vote, but can only be changed if the ruler is prestigious and respected. Since Orcish rulers follow only the Code of Malacath, their personal whims and the rules laid down by their overlords, they ignore the laws set by outlander governments--even if one of those is their liege.

The Empire is run through a more bureaucratic form of government than pure feudalism. While the relation between the Ruby Throne and its subjects is still critical, far more power is reserved to ensure the efficient administration of the Empire. As a result of this, however, the bureaucracy itself can stand as an opponent to any ambitious Emperors.
Vassalage laws determine the nature of the relationship between a liege and their vassals.

Confederate vassalage represents a vassal-liege relationship much like that of the Colovian Estates. The realm shall be restricted to Elective succession, and vassals do not provide levies, instead being called to arms.

Feudalism tightens the relationship between liege and vassal. Vassals must provide levy soldiers to their liege, regardless of their disposition to go to war, and the realm is not limited to Elective succession.

As of late you have been thinking about your right to rule. Your father, while he has managed to hold the realm together, is not the ruler that you could be. As a servant of Malacath, it is your right to challenge him for his rulership.
Perhaps I should bide my time...

Your son [From.GetTitledFirstName] has had the insolence to challenge you for the right to rule before your court. He has come armed and with his followers, and you are sure that there are very few ways that this situation can end.
I shall slay the brat in personal combat!
The time of my rule has ended.
Your father has decided to surrender the throne to you without combat. While his name is disgraced, you are now the sole overlord of your land.
Your father has taken up your challenge and preparations for the duel commence.
After a long battle, you have finally brought your father to his knees. The crowd falls silent just before you deal the final blow.
You quickly prove to be the mightier combatant in the duel. You slowly pick away at your son's defences before he lies helpless at your feet. His followers fall silent as you deal the killing blow.
You fight desperately for your life, but your father proves to be the better. Eventually, you are left battered and bloodied at his feet. While you lie there helpless, he deals the killing blow.
You son deals blows after blow after blow against you. You tire quickly, and before you know it, you see the final strike coming towards you...

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has had the audacity to question my right to rule our people before the entire court. The Code of Malacath demands that I fight with honour, but given my authority, I may be able to postpone the duel indefinitely.
We will see who is worthy to lead our people!
[From.GetBestName] has accepted my challenge of [From.GetHerHis] right to rule. The most prominent warriors in the realm are gathering to witness our combat.

[From.GetBestName] has refused my challenge of [From.GetHerHis] leadership, stating that I am not yet ready to lead. While I may not be able to demand rulership just yet, many warriors were visibly outraged by [From.GetHerHis] cowardice.
That coward thinks I am not worthy leadership?

[other_combatant.GetTitledFirstName] and I circle each other for a short while. Without warning, [other_combatant.GetSheHe] springs at me with a loud roar. After several minutes of vigorous clashing, [From.GetSheHe] is barely able to keep hold of their weapon, which rises to block my final strike just a moment too late.
No one bests a real orc!
Step down and I will spare you.
I still have time to redeem myself.
I must pay the Blood Price.
You will lead our people to greatness.
This ruler has yet to prove themselves as being worthy of leading Malacath's people.
This ruler has violated the Code of Malacath with their cowardice.
[Root.GetBestName] has had [Root.GetHerHis] time leading the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. It is time for a true champion of Malacath to take command.

The Empire of Tamriel is governed in a fashion very similar to the feudal government. However, the strain of running such a large and diverse empire has its challenges, and the ultimate fate of the Empire is heavily influence by Imperial Stability.
The High Chancellor of the Elder Council is one of the most powerful figures in the Empire.

The Imperial City Watch has its origins in the old Legions of the Alessian Empire when elder Legionnaires close to retirement were deployed to permanently garrison the Imperial City. During that time, and since, they served more as Watchmen and enforcers of the law than as a military force. We can however, during times of need, reform the City Watch into an adhoc army and use them to take the fight from the streets of the glorious heart of Tamriel to our enemy's own gates.

All counts and above are given a vote to elect the next ruler of the confederacy from among any landed characters within the realm and the firstborn of the current ruler. Preference is given to electors of higher ranks who are of the same culture and religion as the realm.

All counts and above are given a vote to elect the next ruler of the confederacy from among any landed characters within the realm and the firstborn of the current ruler. Preference is given to electors of higher ranks who are of the same culture and religion as the realm.

The current ruler of the Commune, all members of the liege council, and all members of the Elder Council are given the ability to nominate and vote for a successor among themselves, as well as legitimate siblings and children of the current ruler. Electors in the Commune favor same-culture, same-religion candidates with exceptional leadership skills, preferring those who have the capacity to guide the realm through the challenges of Interregnum Cyrodiil.

The current ruler of the Commune, all members of the liege council, and all members of the Elder Council are given the ability to nominate and vote for a successor among themselves, as well as legitimate siblings and children of the current ruler. Electors in the Commune favor same-culture, same-religion candidates with exceptional leadership skills, preferring those who have the capacity to guide the realm through the challenges of Interregnum Cyrodiil. The ruler of the Commune's vote counts as §YFive§! votes. The High Chancellor of the Elder Council's vote counts as §YThree§! votes.

The current ruler, their spouse, all consorts, parents, siblings, and children, plus council members and the most powerful vassals in the ruler's personal realm, coordinate together to select an acceptable heir from among the ruler's close relatives. Legitimate children, particularly the eldest, are heavily favored. In the absence of a proper direct heir, the spouse of the current ruler may be selected instead. Only adults are involved in the election process. The ruler's vote counts as §YFive§! votes. All other characters' votes count for §YOne§! vote each.

The current ruler, their spouse, all consorts and close relatives, plus council members and the most powerful vassals in the ruler's personal realm, coordinate together to select an acceptable heir from among the ruler's close relatives. Legitimate children are heavily favored. In the absence of a proper direct heir, the spouse of the current ruler may be selected instead. Only adults are involved in the election process. The ruler's vote counts as §YFive§! votes. All other characters' votes count for §YOne§! vote each.

The current Emperor or Empress, all close relatives who are direct vassals or courtiers, all spouses and consorts, along with personal council members and the members of the Elder Council, coordinate together to select an acceptable heir from among the ruler's close relatives. Legitimate children are heavily favored. In the absence of a proper direct heir, the spouse of the current ruler may be selected instead. Only adults are involved in the election process. The Emperor or Empress regnant's vote counts as §YTen§! votes. The High Chancellor of the Elder Council's vote counts as §YFive§! votes. All other characters' votes count for §YOne§! vote each.

The current Emperor or Empress, all close relatives who are direct vassals or courtiers, all spouses and consorts, along with personal council members and the members of the Elder Council, coordinate together to select an acceptable heir from among the ruler's close relatives. Legitimate children are heavily favored. In the absence of a proper direct heir, the spouse of the current ruler may be selected instead. Only adults are involved in the election process. The Emperor or Empress regnant's vote counts as §YTen§! votes. The High Chancellor of the Elder Council's vote counts as §YFive§! votes. All other characters' votes count for §YOne§! vote each.
The current [GetRubyThroneTitle], their spouse, personal council, and all members of the Elder Council coordinate
The current [GetRubyThroneTitle], their spouse, personal council, and all members of the Elder Council coordinate
Reform the Imperial Commune into a more centralized Imperial Republic.
Abandon the Imperial Commune and change your government to a Confederacy, giving greater autonomy to the lesser lords.

The Imperial Commune was the source of stability and prosperity in Cyrodiil ever since the fall of the Reman. As controllers of the Heartlands, we can claim its legacy, and bring peace, stability and prosperity to the province.

These laws dictate the legality of acts of provincial cultural conversion - assimilation through establishing foreign enclaves, forcible removal of inhabitants, and the violent purging of inhabitants.
Peaceful assimilation via use of enclaves is the only legal means of converting provincial culture.
Locals may be driven out of their homeland to facilitate provincial culture conversion. Also allows for the use of §Yenclaves§!.
Locals may be massacred in an effort to convert provincial culture. Also allows for the use of §Yenclaves§! and §Yexpulsion§!.
These laws define the legality of mutilation - such as eye-gouging, castration, disfigurement and removal of limbs - as a means of punishment.
Mutilation, as a form of punishment, is banned within the entire realm. No vassals may have mutilation legalized.
Mutilation, as a form of punishment, is banned within the ruler's personal demesne. Vassals are still allowed to have legal mutilation in their demesne if they so choose.

Mutilation is legalized as a form of punishment in the entire realm, including the ruler's personal demesne. Vassals are allowed to have mutilation legalized or illegalized in their demesne or realm if they so choose.
Your government type cannot usurp kingdoms or empires
column3: Les républiques marchandes et les patriciens ne peuvent pas usurper de royaumes ou d'empires
column4: Handelsrepubliken und Patrizier können keine Königreiche oder Reiche übernehmen
column6: Repúblicas mercantes y patricios no pueden usurpar reinos o imperios.

column2: They are already a king and I am not an §YImperialist§!
